newsitem.title: USA: White House, Republicans say budget deal reached.
newsitem.headline: White House, Republicans say budget deal reached.

text.p: White House officials and Senate Republicans said on Monday they had reached a tentative agreement to cut taxes and balance the budget by 2002.

"We have reached tentative agreement with the administration on the balanced budget ... and tax cut package that is pending review of the statutory language," Senate Majority Leader Trent Lott told a hurriedly assembled news conference.
Asked by reporters about President Clinton's reaction, White House Chief of Staff Erskine Bowles said the president was very pleased.
